item.title: Boeing Closing In on 250-Jet Order as Trump Hosts Erdogan
item.description: Boeing Co. and Lockheed Martin Corp. are poised to win aircraft orders from Turkey as soon as next week for as many as 250 commercial planes and additional F-16 fighter jets, with possible resolution

item.title: Ryanair CEO Expects Boeing Deliveries Ahead of Schedule
item.description: Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary says Boeing has accelerated 737 Max deliveries and is expecting the airline to receive 25 of its 737 jets between August and October, four to five months ahead of schedule.

item.title: Ryanair CEO Expects Boeing Deliveries Ahead of Schedule
item.description: Ryanair CEO Michael O’Leary says Boeing has accelerated 737 Max deliveries and is expecting the airline to receive 25 of its 737 jets between August and October, four to five months ahead of schedule.

item.title: Boeing, Striking Defense Workers Union to Start Talks
item.description: Negotiations between Boeing and striking defense workers are set to resume, marking the first formal talks in three weeks. The walk out has affected more than 3200 hourly workers at key St. Louis plan

item.description: Boeing managed to slow a cash outflow in the second quarter, consuming just $200 million in the three months, and reported a smaller-than-expected loss for the quarter as well as revenue that beat est

item.title: Air India Seeks Loan of About $200 Million For Aircraft Purchase
item.description: Air India is seeking a bank loan of about $200 million to purchase a fleet of Boeing 777 planes from a US-based aircraft leasing company, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: India Orders Fuel-Switch Check on Boeing Jets After Report
item.description: India’s civil aviation authority has ordered an inspection of cockpit fuel switches on Boeing Co. 737 and 787 aircraft operating in the country following a preliminary report linking the deadly crash
